result.execSummary:
The defendant Lora J Seekamp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

  No bars or taverns
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

Participate in & complete OWI court.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow thru with any treatment recommendations.

Credit for 9 days if probation revoked.
.

supervisions.notes:
First 6 months to be served without release, with sentence credit of 128 days and good time to be applied to the first 6 months of sentence

Remaining balance of the sentence to be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Support Services
.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lora J Seekamp
Current: 73 N 3rd St Apt 1, La Crescent, MN 55947 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2014)
Prior: 114 W Spruce St, Houston, MN 55943
OF Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed

Def w/Atty Beatty
  Statement as to Neg. Plea filed
Def pleads guilty
CRT: sentence withheld 3 years probation w/cond: AOdA & comply, no alcohol or CS w/random testing, participate in & complete OWI court, no bars or taverns, any other assess deemed approp by PO & comply, pay CC + DOC Supervision fees, credit for 9 days if probation revoked
assigned PO Amber Hutson

9:15 am Def in court w/Atty Allan E. Beatty.  John W. Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

JS violations - missed tests.  Laura states she didn't fail the am and pm tests.  COURT you missed them.  Laura says they wiped everything out of the system.  COURT:  There was a positive test on the 9th.  Laura says she had a metting with her daughter.  I was taken to the ER and admitted.  I've talked to Kate every day.  Beatty:  Laura has a lot of problems to address as far as her child under CHIPS and her own healh problems.  Kellis at a loss.  I understand there are other issues going on in her life but this is a significant OWI charge.  It's hard to stay confident that she's serious about taking the consequences.  I'm at a loss as to what we can do but detain her untils this is resolved.

COURT addresses Laura.  It would be irresponsible on my part to just stand by.  This is an OWI-6th....  If JS sends me a report saying there's some reason you missed the tests yesterday.  $1,000 cash bond.  No alcohol or drugs w/o Rx from a JS.  No bars or taverns.  Random testing.  Curfew 11pm to 6 am.  No driving.  Comply with JS - testing.    Laura comments further.

SLH for RAG
CRT: Get a time tomorrow

CRT: I received a letter from the Def indicating she has cancer and is undergoing chemo and radiation...
I felt it was appropriate to honor her request for the continuance of the plea.
Beatty comments on sentencing - minimum 6 months w/out release will be hard on her treatment regimen.
Kellis comments, don't mind kicking this out farther - 6 months is the requirement w/out relases.  If we take the plea under statute you are to revoke bond.
Court comments - could impose straight sentence and then she could serve that on EM and follow the request for imposed and stayed and ptu her on probation for that...
Plea/Sentencing: 02-26-14 at 2:00pm w/SLH
Remove from Trial Calendar

11:02 am - Defendant Lora J Seekamp appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty John Kellis appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Allan E Beatty present. 
Beatty - Def has other case scheduled for February.  Requests continuance and will waive time limits
CT:  Waiver FV & I made
PLEA: 2/18/14 @ 10:30 (SLH)
